p: Amentoflavone ( 12) a bi-flavonoid isolated from Selaginella sinensis, Torreya nucifera, and other medicinal plants has shown in vitro potent antiviral activity against respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), with an IC 50 of 5.5 μg/mL [ 35], as well as significant activity against influenza A and B viruses [ 36]. Additionally, amentoflavone ( 12) revealed moderate anti-herpes simplex virus HSV-1 and anti-HSV-2 activities with EC 50 values of 17.9 μg/mL (HSV-1) and 48.0 μg/mL (HSV-2), and also described as SARS-CoV 3CL protease inhibitor with an IC 50 of 8.3 μM [ 37]. This compound has shown high cytotoxicity against MCF-7 and HeLa cancer cell lines [ 38].
